ratings.comment: I took 2 classes from Professor Hutchison many years ago. Can't speak for the present, but in her heyday she was amazing. Very smart, witty, and encyclopedic in her knowledge of Netherlandish painting. Fabulous experience

Hutchinson rocks. She is really kind, helpful, knowledgeable, and an easy grader. She does, however, speak pretty softly. We basically each adopted a museum, wrote a paper on it, and presented it at the end of the semester. In the classes where no one presented, she talked about other museums. I definitely recommend J-Hutch!

I had her for 202 before 330. She really knows her stuff, and actually wrote a text just for this class. It will be boaring if you are not interested in the subject matter, but the grade comes down to three easy tests.
Woman clearly knows her stuff, but is boring, unclear, and speaks in a whisper. Maybe if she used a microphone this class would be better, but she's just plain unorganized. Easy A though.

Pointless.  She mumbles into the mic which only works half the time.  Only phrase heard in first lecture was "DEPTHS OF H*LL!" I stopped going to class a month in and still managed to get 100 on the midterm. Easy tests, useless class.

EASY class. Only three tests, and all you have to do is memorize works of art, some vocab, and write an essay basically comparing mediums.  Her lectures are really useless unless you enjoy random useless facts about the art work in question.  Attendance isn't mandatory-and frankly neither is the book.  Great class.

I loved AP Art History in high school so I took this class.. and it kind of ruined art for me. I stopped going to lecture after a month, and I got a B in the class only because of my memory from ap art last year.  Dont take this class with her if you are semi-interested in art or are looking for something new, or if you dont like memorizing slides.

She definitely knows her stuff, but is a tad oblivious (I can see her walking down the street, lecturing about Durer to no one). If you like art history, and can stay awake in a dark theater with comfy chairs you will love this class. The material can be pretty dull, but Hutchinson always slips a few shocking jokes in.

Extremely frustrating! There is NO syllabus. She just lectures on what she feels like that day and tells you about the next exam one-two weeks before hand. Can be interesting sometimes, but overall really boring lectures. And I love art history.

In a word, TERRIBLE. Mumbles the entire class, Can't fix her microphone which has been shorting out all semester, goes through 50 slides a day and doesn't provide an image list, or stick to the syllabus. Can't tell what artist she is talking about half the time.  Makes occasional jokes, and a nice lady, but she really should not be teaching anymore
She mumbles and never covers material on the exam.

This professor is way to old to be still teaching. She mumbles for an hour and 15 minutes and her lectures are useless. You don't have to go to lecture because half the time she doesn't go over the slides that our on her exams. This is a memorization class and there is no syllabus so TA's don't know what to cover.
Out of touch - useless as a teacher.

i could not deal with the set up of the class. every day she mumbled about the paintings, never really getting to the point. there is no syllabus, she hardly gives you any info to prep for the 3 exams, and it def. was my most frustrating class ive ever taken at UW.

Just like everyone else who's posted, I was initially bored by Prof. Hutchison's lectures because she definitely mumbles.  HOWEVER, if you stick with her you will discover that she is amazingly knowledgeable and approachable.  She doesn't have any of the usual art history professor pompousness, and she will shock you with her dirty jokes.

A little hard to understand the first  class, but sit in the front and listen to what she has to say and you'll see she is incredibly knowledgeable and actually very funny!  she grades pretty easy as long as you are in the ballpark.  would def take more classes from her.

I took several of her courses as an art history major.  The first couple classes were a breeze because she followed the same lecturing/testing formula, but after a while that changed.  She's ungodly boring and her lecturing is 100% useless.  Her lectures are good for napping, though.
an eccentric lady. take her class.

very disorganized, and what we told would be on the exams, wasn't always (always extra info added); however, if you can get past that frustration and the monotone, she is extremely knowledgeable and interesting.  ABOVE ALL, the grading is very fair.

It was an interesting class but she isn't organized. She gives you almost no images and an incomplete syllabus. If you bother her outside of class she will mark you down or assign extra work. Just go to class.She does give you past exam questions and tells you what you need to know for her exams.Take the 4 credit option bc it's 2 bookreports xtra

omg sooooooooooo boring and dull and monotone. she'll surprise you with the dirty joke but not often enough. i stopped going to the majority of lectures, memorized the works on my own, and came out with an AB pretty effortlessly.

I found her very difficult to understand, both in subject matter and speaking voice. The tests were impossible to study for and on the final there was material I'd never seen before. Probably the most frustrating class I had at UW-Madison.
All the other comments are more or less true.

Incredibly boring lectures. Wasted alot of time some lectures--so much so that she had to skip a great deal of 20th century art. Honors students have an easier class--2 10+ papers (easy ones!) and a midterm vs. three midterms with a hell of alot of memorization.
Wow, she's monotone. But she makes dirty jokes a lot. She knows so much and she frequently goes off on tangents, but you'll learn a lot. Class is basic memorization, easy tests, no papers.

A bit boring at times, true, but there is so much depth to her knowledge of Netherlandish Art, it is a resource not to be taken granted. Easy grader, especially if you are in Honors. 2 Papers, and the Final. 15 pages of a biography, and its an A. Avoid if not readily interested, but try and enjoy.

The class is great, but the prof. is so boring.  I probably slept two out the three lectures.  Her jokes are pretty funny, however dry. You actually dont even need to go to class because she just includes extraneous info in the lec. Easy A and interesting material. Just try to get a diff. prof.

True, tests are few and easy. She is boring! The big problem I have with her is that her syllabus is terrible:no page #s, deadlines, exam dates etc. And you have to look up images online on your own, she has no course website.

I agree with the following people, but there are 3 tests.  If you can sign up for honors it's awesome, no tests, 3 easy papers and she gives everyone A's basically.  Her lectures are similar to taking a sleeping pill, so be prepared.  But she does talk dirty, and when you least expect it.  Funny!
yeah i agree with the previous review ... funny, odd, but damn drink plenty of coffee I found myself dozing a lot in her class.

I dropped out 3rd week because I was bored outa my mind.  TOo bad, cuz i was excited about the material.  I couldnn't undertand her, her monotony is better than a sleeping pill.  Who the hel was she really talking to during lecture?  certainly not the class, she sounded bored herself.  mybe/j unusal

She seemed boring at first because of the monotone, but eventually you realize she's really a pretty interesting lecturer.  But she doesn't explain anything about expectations, the TA's are the only ones who handle your grades for the class, and your whole grade basically rests on 3 tests.

At first I hated her class because she seems uber-boring and talks in a monotone.  But WAIT!  She says hilarious dirty jokes when no ones paying attention.  She is awsome!  Plus, the class is super easy, the only participation required is 2 tests that she tells you what you need to know. Take her!!!

Dry, yes, but terribly sweet.  Like a good sherry.  Learned a-plenty about Northern Renaissance art; went on to write a well-received series of papers thereupon; I credit Jane.  Her liberal use art-hist terminology will confound some, titilate others; do your homework and you'll be richly rewarded.
Absolutely useless. She is insanely boring and speaks in a monotone voice. She never discusses course expectations or exams. Killed any interest i had in art history. Stay Away
so dry its funny
Hutchison's dry sense of humor is reason enough to stay awake in the comfy seats of the LVM lecture halls.
No Comments
A tool.  Lectures boring & useless, and she's so unclear on structure of course.
